title: ANGEL JUSTICE (SILKE JUSTICE)
features: Silke and Haven Justice are tasked by the Pinkerton Detective Agency to track down and eliminate a Red sex slave ring in the New Mexico area. Young Indian girls and some white, are being kidnapped and sold to bordellos.They are assisted by Bone and Loraine and Deputy Sheriff Nathan Tyree of Santa Fe, along with Bear Dog.Not only do they have to deal with vile criminals, but also, with the evil Skinwalkers of Navajo legend and lore in the Valles Caldera of New Mexico.What are Skinwalkers?Where do they come from?Read ANGEL JUSTICE to see how Silke and Haven deal with both the physical evil and the Amerindian world of mystical evil.
description: Ken Farmer added to the Hall of Fame for Western Writers.
details: {"Publisher": "Timber Creek Press (April 16, 2020)", "Language": "English", "Paperback": "320 pages", "ISBN 10": "1734176555", "ISBN 13": "978-1734176551", "Item Weight": "14.4 ounces", "Dimensions": "5.5 x 0.8 x 8.5 inches"}

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/S/amzn-author-media-prod/kjuk529fo5g8j511sdq7ochi26._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Ken Farmer', 'about': ['Ken Farmer named to the Hall of Fame for Western Writers Ken has written and released 50 novels to date. Has multiple Best-Sellers and has won nine awards so far, including: Two Laramie Awards, One Clue Award, Four Firebird Awards and an Eric Hoffer Award.', "Ken Farmer's dialogue flows like a beautiful western river...it's the gold standard. - Carole Beers", "Ken Farmer didn't write his first full novel until he was sixty-nine years of age. He often wonders what the hell took him so long. At age seventy-nine, he released novel #37 on Sept. 19th, 2020...THREE CREEKS. it just may be his opus. He has released book two in the THREE CREEKS series...RED HILL ROAD, followed by book #3 in the series...THE POND.", "The THREE CREEKS series is late 1940s Southern Noir Mysteries in the vein of To Kill a Mockingbird and The Rock Hole by Reavis Wortham. Ken's new publisher, Dusty Saddle Publishing, just released novel #50...FOOT & HUCH, book #9 of the Three Creeks Mystery series. The first in the series, THREE CREEK won the Firebird Award for Best Mystery of 2020. Book #2 RED HILL ROAD has won the Firebird Award for Best Mystery of 2021 and Best Southern Noir - 2021.", 'Novel #36 was SKINWALKER JUSTICE, a Western Supernatural thriller, book #5 in the Silke Justice series.', 'STEELDUST, started the BONE & LORAINE spin-off with modern day detectives, Bone and Loraine being accidentally transported back in time to 1898. Current WIP is novel #51...TOBYMAN, book #3 of the Best Selling COLTRANE classic western series.', 'Ken spent thirty years raising Beefmaster cattle and Quarter horses in Texas and forty-five years as a professional actor (after a stint in the Marine Corps). Those years gave him a background for storytelling…or as he has been known to say, "I\'ve always been a bit of a bull---t artist, so writing novels kind of came naturally once it occurred to me I could put my stories down on paper. I don\'t write about outlaws and peace officers...I write about people.', "Ken's writing style has been likened to a combination of Louis L'Amour and Terry C. Johnston with an occasional Hitchcockian twist.", 'In addition to his love for writing fiction, he likes to teach acting, voice-over and writing workshops. His favorite expression is: "Just tell the damn story."', "Writing has become Ken's second life: he has been a Marine, played collegiate football, been a Texas wildcatter, cattle and horse rancher, professional film and TV actor and now...a novelist. Who knew?", "I've read many Zane Grey and Louis L'Amour novels, but I enjoy Ken Farmer's the best! - Dr. Ernest Martin, DDS.", 'Contact: pagact@yahoo.com or Ken on FB - https://www.facebook.com/groups/343634849935636', '"Ken is a magnificent writer. I enjoy everything he writes whether it is about the old west, southern noir mysteries, or about the modern Black Eagle Force. - Israel Drazin TOP 1000 REVIEWER & VINE VOICE.', "And NO! I don't write about Rome. I don't write erotica...It's not me."]}
